decision_conditions: Where there is deadwood with in the canopy of the tree, there is no requirement to gain permission to remove this, but this is covered as a notification that work is intended to remove deadwood from the Ash trees T13 and T14.

It is recommended that these Ash trees T13 and T14 as shown on the Havering TPO plan 7/90 can be pruned as shown on the application to carry out tree works to a TPO tree (T13) identified as T2 overall crown reduce by no more than 2m.
TPO tree (T14) identified as G1 can be overall crown reduction of up to 3m, to previous pruning points.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
description:
Rear Boundary - Middle
G1 - 2x Ash
Reduce near to previous reduction points, retaining healthy growth, by a reduction of up to approximately 3 metres of the branch length, remove deadwood, remove Ivy.

.	The trees are located to the rear of the car park area on the rear boundary
.	Reduction works are part of a maintenance program to maintain the trees at suitable size for their locations
.	To reduce the encroachment from the neighbouring gardens to the rear of the rear boundary
.	To reduce the encroachment over the car park area
.	To reduce branch and limb end weight and to reduce the risk of branch or limb failure
.	To allow more light in to the area

Rear Boundary - Left Hand Side
T2 - Ash
Reduce height and width by up to approximately 1.8 metres of the branch length, remove deadwood, remove ivy.

.	The tree is located to the rear of the car park area on the rear boundary area on the left hand side
.	Reduction works are part of a maintenance program to maintain the tree at a suitable size for its location
.	To reduce the encroachment from the neighbouring gardens to the rear of the rear boundary
